file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 31-34-02-04 - CONFIG-1 - OQAR UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OQAR UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the Optical Quick-Access Recorder (OQAR) Unit. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH 31-34-02-000-801-A OQAR UNIT - REMOVAL OQAR AIRCRAFT WITH 31-34-02-400-801-A OQAR UNIT - INSTALLATION OQAR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-34-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 2. OQAR UNIT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the OQAR Unit. (2) The OQAR recorder is installed in the rear electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 31-34-01-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section I - right side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Protect the optical lens and carriage assem- GSE 290 OQAR Transit Disk bly inside the optical drive E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the overhead panel, open the QAR circuit breaker. (2) Open door 272DR to get access to the rear electronic compartment. (3) Remove the optical disk from the OQAR (AMM TASK 31-34-01-000-801-A/400) if installed . EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A CAUTION:BEFORE THE OQAR IS INSTALLED AND REMOVED, THE QAR CIRCUIT BREAKER MUST BE OPENED TO MAKE SURE THAT NO POWER IS APPLIED TO THE ARINC CONNECTOR IN THE OQAR RACK ASSEMBLY. THIS WILL PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ARINC CONNECTOR. (1) Put the transit disk (GSE 290) into the OQAR drive. (2) Turn the tray thumbscrews counterclockwise to disengage them from the equipment hold-down hooks. (3) Slowly pull the OQAR recorder handle forward to disconnect the OQAR and tray connectors from each other and slide the unit out of the tray. (4) Put the protective cover on the electrical connector. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

O AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR OQAR Unit - Removal/Installation Figure 401 DOOR 272DR A ZONE B 272 DET. A DET. B 145AMM310183.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-34-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH OQAR 3. OQAR UNIT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the OQAR Unit. (2) The OQAR recorder is installed in the rear electronic compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 31-34-00-700-801-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Fuselage rear section I - right side D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION:BEFORE THE OQAR IS INSTALLED AND REMOVED, THE QAR CIRCUIT BREAKER MUST BE OPENED TO MAKE SURE THAT NO POWER IS APPLIED TO THE ARINC CONNECTOR IN THE OQAR RACK ASSEMBLY. THIS WILL PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ARINC CONNECTOR. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the QAR circuit breaker is open. (2) Put the OQAR into the tray and slide it rearwards until its connector is fully engaged with the mating connector of the tray. (3) Put the thumbscrews on the equipment hold-down hooks. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Screw until the back connector is correctly engaged. (5) Remove the transit disk as follows: (a) Open the OQAR front access door. (b) Remove the eject tool which is stored in the SPARE DISK storage drawer. CAUTION:USE THE MANUAL EJECTION METHOD VERY CAREFULLY TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE PARTS OF THE OQAR DRIVE UNIT. (c) Put the eject pin into the pin hole visible at the right bottom side of the optical disk drive. (d) Remove the transit disk. (e) Replace the eject pin in the SPARE DISK storage drawer. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Do an OQAR operational test (AMM TASK 31-34-00-700-801-A/500). (2) Close door 272DR (rear electronic compartment door). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 31-34-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
